intro: Haplochorema latilabrum, commonly known as the broad-lipped hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its large, showy flowers with five broad petals and a prominent central pistil. Its leaves are usually ovate with a smooth surface and a slightly hairy underside. Haplochorema latilabrum thrives in humid, well-drained soils and is often found in open woodlands or along riverbanks.
